intro: Cryptolluma, commonly known as the false hellebore, is a genus of flowering plants in the family Liliaceae. It consists of several species, most of which are perennial herbs native to Europe and western Asia. The plants typically have dark green, lance-shaped leaves and produce small, greenish or white flowers in clusters. They are often found in moist, shaded environments such as woodlands and stream banks. Cryptolluma species are noted for their ornamental value and are sometimes cultivated in gardens for their foliage and unique floral displays.
